channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Quilt-1M: One Million Image-Text Pairs for Histopathology
item.description: From YouTube, we curate Quilt: a large-scale vision-language dataset consisting of $768, 826$ image and text pairs.

item.title: Deep Learning of Dynamical System Parameters from Return Maps as Images
item.description: We present a novel approach to system identification (SI) using deep learning techniques.

item.title: Dense Video Object Captioning from Disjoint Supervision
item.description: We show our task is more general than grounding, and models trained on our task can directly be applied to grounding by finding the bounding box with the maximum likelihood of generating the query sentence.

item.title: OpenSTL: A Comprehensive Benchmark of Spatio-Temporal Predictive Learning
item.description: Spatio-temporal predictive learning is a learning paradigm that enables models to learn spatial and temporal patterns by predicting future frames from given past frames in an unsupervised manner.

item.title: Masked Diffusion Models are Fast Learners
item.description: Diffusion models have emerged as the de-facto technique for image generation, yet they entail significant computational overhead, hindering the technique's broader application in the research community.

item.title: Augmenting Sub-model to Improve Main Model
item.description: While the main model employs conventional training recipes, the sub-model leverages the benefit of additional regularization.

item.title: UUKG: Unified Urban Knowledge Graph Dataset for Urban Spatiotemporal Prediction
item.description: We hope the proposed UUKG fosters research on urban knowledge graphs and broad smart city applications.

item.title: How can objects help action recognition?
item.description: In this paper, we investigate how we can use knowledge of objects to design better video models, namely to process fewer tokens and to improve recognition accuracy.

item.title: Deep Double Self-Expressive Subspace Clustering
item.description: The key idea of our solution is to view the self-expressive coefficient as a feature representation of the example to get another coefficient matrix.

item.title: PyRCA: A Library for Metric-based Root Cause Analysis
item.description: We introduce PyRCA, an open-source Python machine learning library of Root Cause Analysis (RCA) for Artificial Intelligence for IT Operations (AIOps).

item.title: SeFNet: Bridging Tabular Datasets with Semantic Feature Nets
item.description: In this paper, we present an example of SeFNet prepared for a collection of predictive tasks in healthcare, with the features' relations derived from the SNOMED-CT ontology.

item.title: GenPlot: Increasing the Scale and Diversity of Chart Derendering Data
item.description: Vertical bars, horizontal bars, dot, scatter, and line plots provide a diverse set of visualizations to represent data.

item.title: The Ecological Fallacy in Annotation: Modelling Human Label Variation goes beyond Sociodemographics
item.description: To account for sociodemographics in models of individual annotator behaviour, we introduce group-specific layers to multi-annotator models.

item.title: Data Structures for Density Estimation
item.description: We study statistical/computational tradeoffs for the following density estimation problem: given $k$ distributions $v_1, \ldots, v_k$ over a discrete domain of size $n$, and sampling access to a distribution $p$, identify $v_i$ that is "close" to $p$.

item.title: Delegated Classification
item.description: When machine learning is outsourced to a rational agent, conflicts of interest might arise and severely impact predictive performance.

item.title: Learning Locally Interpretable Rule Ensemble
item.description: To avoid this trade-off and learn an interpretable rule ensemble without degrading accuracy, we introduce a new concept of interpretability, named local interpretability, which is evaluated by the total number of rules necessary to express individual predictions made by the model, rather than to express the model itself.

item.title: A Bayesian Take on Gaussian Process Networks
item.description: Gaussian Process Networks (GPNs) are a class of directed graphical models which employ Gaussian processes as priors for the conditional expectation of each variable given its parents in the network.

item.title: Did the Models Understand Documents? Benchmarking Models for Language Understanding in Document-Level Relation Extraction
item.description: Then, we conduct investigations and reveal the fact that: In contrast to humans, the representative state-of-the-art (SOTA) models in DocRE exhibit different decision rules.

item.title: GraphGLOW: Universal and Generalizable Structure Learning for Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Graph structure learning is a well-established problem that aims at optimizing graph structures adaptive to specific graph datasets to help message passing neural networks (i. e., GNNs) to yield effective and robust node embeddings.

item.title: Decentralized Quantum Federated Learning for Metaverse: Analysis, Design and Implementation
item.description: To this end, we develop a decentralized and trustworthy quantum federated learning (QFL) framework.

item.title: HK-LegiCoST: Leveraging Non-Verbatim Transcripts for Speech Translation
item.description: We introduce HK-LegiCoST, a new three-way parallel corpus of Cantonese-English translations, containing 600+ hours of Cantonese audio, its standard traditional Chinese transcript, and English translation, segmented and aligned at the sentence level.

item.title: A Simple and Effective Pruning Approach for Large Language Models
item.description: Motivated by the recent observation of emergent large magnitude features in LLMs, our approach prune weights with the smallest magnitudes multiplied by the corresponding input activations, on a per-output basis.

item.title: Progressive Neural Representation for Sequential Video Compilation
item.description: Neural Implicit Representations (NIR) have gained significant attention recently due to their ability to represent complex and high-dimensional data.

item.title: FedNoisy: Federated Noisy Label Learning Benchmark
item.description: Federated learning has gained popularity for distributed learning without aggregating sensitive data from clients.

item.title: TransRef: Multi-Scale Reference Embedding Transformer for Reference-Guided Image Inpainting
item.description: For precise utilization of the reference features for guidance, a reference-patch alignment (Ref-PA) module is proposed to align the patch features of the reference and corrupted images and harmonize their style differences, while a reference-patch transformer (Ref-PT) module is proposed to refine the embedded reference feature.

item.title: On Evaluating Multilingual Compositional Generalization with Translated Datasets
item.description: To address this limitation, we craft a faithful rule-based translation of the MCWQ dataset from English to Chinese and Japanese.

item.title: GIO: Gradient Information Optimization for Training Dataset Selection
item.description: It is often advantageous to train models on a subset of the available train examples, because the examples are of variable quality or because one would like to train with fewer examples, without sacrificing performance.

item.title: Traversing Between Modes in Function Space for Fast Ensembling
item.description: While this provides a way to efficiently train ensembles, for inference, multiple forward passes should still be executed using all the ensemble parameters, which often becomes a serious bottleneck for real-world deployment.

item.title: Informed POMDP: Leveraging Additional Information in Model-Based RL
item.description: We then show that this informed objective consists of learning an environment model from which we can sample latent trajectories.

item.title: CAPRI: Context-Aware Interpretable Point-of-Interest Recommendation Framework
item.description: Point-of-Interest (POI ) recommendation systems have gained popularity for their unique ability to suggest geographical destinations with the incorporation of contextual information such as time, location, and user-item interaction.

item.title: IMP-MARL: a Suite of Environments for Large-scale Infrastructure Management Planning via MARL
item.description: We introduce IMP-MARL, an open-source suite of multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL) environments for large-scale Infrastructure Management Planning (IMP), offering a platform for benchmarking the scalability of cooperative MARL methods in real-world engineering applications.

item.title: Multi-Fidelity Active Learning with GFlowNets
item.description: For example, in scientific discovery, we are often faced with the problem of exploring very large, high-dimensional spaces, where querying a high fidelity, black-box objective function is very expensive.

item.title: Dynamic Perceiver for Efficient Visual Recognition
item.description: Early exits are placed exclusively within the classification branch, thus eliminating the need for linear separability in low-level features.

item.title: MSVD-Indonesian: A Benchmark for Multimodal Video-Text Tasks in Indonesian
item.description: Since the availability of the pretraining resources with Indonesian sentences is relatively limited, the applicability of those approaches to our dataset is still questionable.

item.title: OpenP5: Benchmarking Foundation Models for Recommendation
item.description: We also provide comprehensive evaluation results of the library over the two downstream tasks, the ten datasets, and the three item indexing methods to facilitate reproducibility and future research.

item.title: A VAE Approach to Sample Multivariate Extremes
item.description: We illustrate the relevance of our approach on a synthetic data set and on a real data set of discharge measurements along the Danube river network.

item.title: Simple and Fast Group Robustness by Automatic Feature Reweighting
item.description: A major challenge to out-of-distribution generalization is reliance on spurious features -- patterns that are predictive of the class label in the training data distribution, but not causally related to the target.

item.title: Unsupervised Framework for Evaluating and Explaining Structural Node Embeddings of Graphs
item.description: For classical node embeddings there exists a framework which helps data scientists to identify (in an unsupervised way) a few embeddings that are worth further investigation.

item.title: Deep Reinforcement Learning with Multitask Episodic Memory Based on Task-Conditioned Hypernetwork
item.description: Deep reinforcement learning algorithms are usually impeded by sampling inefficiency, heavily depending on multiple interactions with the environment to acquire accurate decision-making capabilities.

item.title: To Fold or Not to Fold: Graph Regularized Tensor Train for Visual Data Completion
item.description: Tensor train (TT) representation has achieved tremendous success in visual data completion tasks, especially when it is combined with tensor folding.

item.title: BioREx: Improving Biomedical Relation Extraction by Leveraging Heterogeneous Datasets
item.description: State-of-the-art methods were used primarily to train machine learning models on individual RE datasets, such as protein-protein interaction and chemical-induced disease relation.

item.title: Scaling of Class-wise Training Losses for Post-hoc Calibration
item.description: The class-wise training losses often diverge as a result of the various levels of intra-class and inter-class appearance variation, and we find that the diverging class-wise training losses cause the uncalibrated prediction with its reliability.

item.title: Pattern Mining for Anomaly Detection in Graphs: Application to Fraud in Public Procurement
item.description: In the context of public procurement, several indicators called red flags are used to estimate fraud risk.

item.title: Fine-Tuning Language Models for Scientific Writing Support
item.description: Firstly, we propose a regression model trained on a corpus of scientific sentences extracted from peer-reviewed scientific papers and non-scientific text to assign a score that indicates the scientificness of a sentence.

item.title: Substitutional Alloying Using Crystal Graph Neural Networks
item.description: Materials discovery, especially for applications that require extreme operating conditions, requires extensive testing that naturally limits the ability to inquire the wealth of possible compositions.

item.title: Design of an Axial Flux Permanent Magnet Eddy Current Brake for Application on Light Weight Motor Vehicles
item.description: Axial flux permanent magnet designs are compact and becoming an attractive design for electric vehicles as an auxiliary braking system.

item.title: Spatial-Temporal Graph Learning with Adversarial Contrastive Adaptation
item.description: In addition, we introduce a cross-view contrastive learning paradigm to model the inter-dependencies across view-specific region representations and preserve underlying relation heterogeneity.

item.title: CAMMARL: Conformal Action Modeling in Multi Agent Reinforcement Learning
item.description: In this article, we propose a novel multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL) algorithm CAMMARL, which involves modeling the actions of other agents in different situations in the form of confident sets, i. e., sets containing their true actions with a high probability.

item.title: FDNet: Focal Decomposed Network for Efficient, Robust and Practical Time Series Forecasting
item.description: Moreover, we propose focal input sequence decomposition method which decomposes input sequence in a focal manner for efficient and robust forecasting when facing Long Sequence Time series Input (LSTI) problem.

item.title: BayLing: Bridging Cross-lingual Alignment and Instruction Following through Interactive Translation for Large Language Models
item.description: To minimize human workload, we propose to transfer the capabilities of language generation and instruction following from English to other languages through an interactive translation task.
